response.answer_text: Infor probably runs 28 to 30 different ERP programs, from companies acquired over the last 15 years or so. More company info in a 2015 answer here Gene Hammons's answer to What does a company called Infor do? So some Infor ERP products are quite good, some are not really supported for new sales at all - mostly sunsetted and Infor encourages current customers to move to the more supported and development oriented ERP packages. And while Infor has made some progress in new development over the past few years, they’re still notoriously hard to work with - my consulting team helps companies evaluate, select and purchase ERP - and even though I one time was an Infor employee, I can’t even buy Infor products without 2–4 weeks of trying to find the right sales team within the organization. Imagine how a company who doesn’t do this for a living would fare? Latest word on the street is that Infor is focused on an upcoming IPO and that’s the primary strategy of the current management - which makes sense because they’re not exactly ‘sales’ focused. So - if you know which ERP products Infor is showcasing with new development and features, you can end up with a great ERP package. I’d not attempt to get into the Infor forest without a guide who knows a bit about the company.

Infor LN ( previously Baan) is an advanced, easy-to-use ERP solution that brings together a wide range of business functions to serve the needs of leading discrete and project-based manufacturers in industries such as industrial equipment and machinery, high-tech and electronics, component manufacturing, commercial aerospace, and shipbuilding. A fully integrated solution, Infor LN provides flexible global business operations support across all departments including finance, warehousing, freight management, and aftermarket service. Companies using Infor LN are able to improve their agility and lower their total cost of ownership. A scalable, multi-language, open systems platform, Infor LN features capabilities for multi-plant business process modeling and enhancing information visibility for improved decision-making. The core manufacturing and planning functionality in Infor LN is ideal for companies in make-to-stock, assemble-to-order, make-to-order, or engineer-to-order environments.
